TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BamlLocalizableResourceKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a key that is used to identify localizable resources in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents a key that can uniquely identify a localizable value inside [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_baml](~/includes/tlasharptla-baml-md.md)]. It represents a combination of a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResourceKey.Uid%2A>, class name, and property name.
The <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResourceKey.Uid%2A> value must be added to the source [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] file either by using the `updateuid` [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_msbuild](~/includes/tlasharptla-msbuild-md.md)] target (for example, `msbuild /t:updateuid myproj.proj`), or manually in the markup. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] without a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResourceKey.Uid%2A> cannot be localized. The class name is the type name of the element that contains the localizable property. The property name refers to the property that has the localizable value. A special property called "`$Content`" is used to represent values that are the initialization text or content property of an element. For example the `$Content` property name would apply to the initialization text `Click` in the following XAML:
`<TextBlock x:Uid="myBlock">Click </TextBlock>`
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResourceKey>.
[!code-csharp[GrabBaml#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GrabBaml/CSharp/GrabBaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[GrabBaml#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GrabBaml/visualbasic/grabbaml.vb#1)]

The property name of a localizable resource in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)].

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the assembly that defines the type of the localizable resource as declared by its .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The assembly name is not required to uniquely identify a resource in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] but is included here as a convenience.
